Package pgui.type

Class Palette

java.lang.Object
pgui.type.Palette
public class Palette extends Object
A datatype for storing and accessing a colour palette. This class is used for organising different colours associated with an object into one class Each Window has its own colour palette. This palette is transferred to each Element within the window.

  • Constructor Details

    • Palette

      public Palette(int background, int stroke, int primary, int highlight, int select)
      This defines the colours stored within the Palette. Use the color() method for each parameters.
      Parameters:
      background - background
      stroke - stroke
      primary - primary
      highlight - highlight
      select - select

  • Method Details

    • copy

      public Palette copy()
      A copy method to create a new Palette object for later alterations
      Returns:
      Equivalent Palette object

    • fade

      public Palette fade(int colourTo, float amount, processing.core.PApplet sketch)
      Returns a faded copy of the current Palette. Linearly interpolates between each colour in the Palette and colourTo.
      Parameters:
      colourTo - Colour to fade towards - background colour of parent window
      amount - Degree of fading, between 0.0 and 1.0
      sketch - A reference to Processing sketch
      Returns:
      A new faded Palette object
      See Also:
      • lerpColor()
